name: google-resource-manager
label: Google Resource Manager
description: Google Cloud Resource Manager is a service provided by Google Cloud Platform (GCP) that helps you manage your GCP resources across projects. It provides a unified interface for organizing, viewing, and controlling access to your cloud resources.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server
fields.description: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Client ID
fields.name: client_id
fields.description: Unique Client ID of the Google Resource Manager that is used to create an authentication token required to access the Google Resource Manager API.
fields.tooltip: Unique Client ID of the Google Resource Manager that is used to create an authentication token required to access the Google Resource Manager API.

fields.title: Client Secret
fields.name: client_secret
fields.description: Unique Client Secret of the Google Resource Manager that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the client secret, see https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/web-server.
fields.tooltip: Unique Client Secret of the Google Resource Manager that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Authorization Code
fields.name: code
fields.tooltip: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Accessing the Google Resource Manager API section.
fields.description: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Accessing the Google Resource Manager API section.

fields.title: Redirect URL
fields.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.
fields.name: redirect_url
fields.tooltip: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Search Organizations
operations.description: Searches organization resources that are visible to the user and satisfy the specified filter parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Specify the query string used to filter the organizations to return in the response. Query rules are case-insensitive.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the query string used to filter the organizations to return in the response. Query rules are case-insensitive.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from Google Resource Manager.
parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from Google Resource Manager.

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.description: Specify a Page Token if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextPageToken element, the value of the nextPageToken element includes a Page Token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.tooltip: Specify a Page Token if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextPageToken element, the value of the nextPageToken element includes a Page Token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get organization Details
operations.description: Retrieves an organization details based on the project name you have specified.

parameters.title: Organization Name
parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the organization based on which you want to retrieve organization details from Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization based on which you want to retrieve organization details from Google Resource Manager.

operations.title: Create Project
operations.description: Creates a project in Google Resource Manager based on the project ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique user-assigned ID of the project. It must be 6 to 30 lowercase ASCII letters, digits, or hyphens. It must start with a letter. Trailing hyphens are prohibited. For example: tokyo-rain-123

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: A user-assigned display name of the project. When present it must be between 4 to 30 characters. Allowed characters are: lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers, hyphen, single-quote, double-quote, space, and exclamation point.

parameters.title: Labels
parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Specify the labels for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager. For example, {"label_key": "label_value", "label_key1": "label_value1"}
parameters.tooltip: Specify the label for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Specify the tags for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager. For example, {"tag_key": "tag_value" , "tag_key1": "tag_value1"}
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tags for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_parameters
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager. For reference, https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/reference/rest/v3/projects#Project
parameters.description: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager. For reference, https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/reference/rest/v3/projects#Project

operations.title: Search Projects
operations.description: Searches for a projects based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Specify the query string for searching for projects, If multiple fields are included in the query, then it will return results that match any of the fields. For Reference: https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/reference/rest/v3/projects/search#query-parameters
parameters.tooltip: Specify the query string for searching for projects, If multiple fields are included in the query, then it will return results that match any of the fields.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from Google Resource Manager.
parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from Google Resource Manager.

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.description: Specify a Page Token if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextPageToken element, the value of the nextPageToken element includes a Page Token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.tooltip: Specify a Page Token if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextPageToken element, the value of the nextPageToken element includes a Page Token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Project Details
operations.description: Retrieves an project details based on the project name you have specified.

parameters.title: Project Name
parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to retrieve project details from Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to retrieve project details from Google Resource Manager.

operations.title: Update Project
operations.description: Updates an specific project details in Google Resource Manager based on the project name and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Project Name
parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to update project details in Google Docs.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to update project details in Google Docs.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to update project in Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: A user-assigned display name of the project. When present it must be between 4 to 30 characters. Allowed characters are: lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers, hyphen, single-quote, double-quote, space, and exclamation point.

parameters.title: Labels
parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Specify the labels for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager. For example, {"label_key": "label_value", "label_key1": "label_value1"}
parameters.tooltip: Specify the label for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Specify the tags for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager. For example, {"tag_key": "tag_value" , "tag_key1": "tag_value1"}
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tags for the project based on which you want to create project in Google Resource Manager.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_parameters
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to update documents in Google Docs. For reference, https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/reference/rest/v3/projects#Project
parameters.description: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to update documents in Google Docs. For reference, https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/reference/rest/v3/projects#Project

operations.title: Delete Project
operations.description: Deletes an specific project details based on the project name you have specified.

parameters.title: Project Name
parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to delete project details from Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to delete project details from Google Resource Manager.

operations.title: Restore Project
operations.description: Restore a specific project details based on the project name you have specified.

parameters.title: Project Name
parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to restore project details from Google Resource Manager.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the project based on which you want to restore project details from Google Resource Manager.
